segments.title: To be or not to be
segments.source: Estimated based on BBC 1980 Hamlet total runtime of 212 minutes. Act 3 Scene 1 typically occurs around 45% through the play, placing it approximately at 1:35:00-1:39:00. The soliloquy itself is roughly 4 minutes.
segments.notes: Total film runtime 212 minutes (3h32m). Act 3 Scene 1 is the structural middle of the play.

segments.title: Tomorrow and tomorrow and tomorrow
segments.source: Act 5 Scene 5 occurs near the end of the 159-minute film. Estimated at approximately 2:20:00 based on play structure where this scene is in the final 10% of the drama.
segments.notes: Total film runtime 159 minutes. Scene follows Lady Macbeth's death announcement.

segments.title: Is this a dagger which I see before me
segments.source: Academic analysis from ecampusontario.pressbooks.pub confirms scene occurs at 38:27-38:36 mark, with the full dagger speech running 3:45 in length.
segments.notes: Stewart delivers this in one prolonged take. Act 2 Scene 1. Full speech approximately 3:45 duration.

segments.title: Now is the winter of our discontent
segments.source: Multiple sources confirm soliloquy begins approximately 5:30 into film. Public toast portion runs 5:39-6:44, followed by private bathroom mirror portion. Total opening sequence including both parts approximately 8 minutes.
segments.notes: Unique staging: first part as public toast, second part in bathroom mirror speaking directly to camera. Film runtime 104 minutes.

segments.title: Now is the winter of our discontent
segments.source: Opening soliloquy in Olivier's film. Includes additional lines from Henry VI Part 3. Estimated at film opening after brief credits.
segments.notes: Film runtime 161 minutes. Olivier added lines from 3 Henry VI to the opening speech.

segments.title: To be or not to be
segments.source: Branagh's uncut Hamlet is 242 minutes. Act 3 Scene 1 at approximately 45% runtime places it around 1:50:00. Famous mirror/hall scene.
segments.notes: Film runtime 242 minutes (4h02m). Shot in hall of mirrors with camera slowly zooming in. Branagh delivers in slow whisper.

segments.title: Is this a dagger which I see before me
segments.source: Polanski's Macbeth is 140 minutes. Act 2 Scene 1 typically around 25-30% into the play, estimated at approximately 40:00.
segments.notes: Film runtime 140 minutes. Polanski's version noted for its graphic realism.

segments.title: Tomorrow and tomorrow and tomorrow
segments.source: Act 5 Scene 5 near end of 140-minute film. Estimated at approximately 2:00:00.

metadata.researchNotes: Timestamps gathered from web research. 'verified' confidence means specific timestamps were found in academic or production sources. 'estimated' means calculated based on play structure and known film runtimes.
metadata.estimationMethod: For estimated timestamps: Act 3 Scene 1 (To be or not to be) typically occurs at 40-50% of Hamlet runtime. Act 2 Scene 1 (Is this a dagger) at 25-30% of Macbeth. Act 5 Scene 5 (Tomorrow) at 85-90% of Macbeth. Richard III opening soliloquy is in first 10 minutes.
sources: ecampusontario.pressbooks.pub - Goold Macbeth analysis with timestamps
shakespeareflix.net - Ian McKellen Richard III soliloquy analysis
